events.title: Brew Day - Reminder - Batch #14 (SMaSH Sabro)
events.description: You have a planned Batch upcoming (SMaSH Sabro)
events.descriptionHTML: You have a planned Batch upcoming (SMaSH Sabro)

batchMiscs.name: NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water

batchYeasts.name: New England
batchYeasts.description: LalBrew New England is an ale strain selected specifically for its ability to produce a unique fruit-forward ester profile desired in East Coast styles of beer. A typical fermentation with LalBrew New England will produce tropical and fruity esters, notably stone fruits like peach. Through expression of a β-glucosidase enzyme, LalBrew New England can promote hop biotransformation and accentuate hop flavor and aroma. LalBrew New England exhibits medium to high attenuation with medium flocculation, making it a perfect choice for East Coast style ales.

notes.note: Added 12.76 grams Sabro pellet hops for dry hopping.

batchHops.name: Sabro (T90)
batchHops.notes:
Sister to the well-known experimental HBC 472, Sabro exhibits many of the same characteristics, such as the coconut aroma. It imparts a strong and complex fruit flavour to beer, and has been described as having a mango, grapefruit, lemon grass and wood aroma, as well as the unique coconut.
PEDIGREE
“Unique cross pollenatoin with female neomexicanus ”
RECOMMENDED BEER STYLES
American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, IPA, NEIPA, Porter, Stout
KEY FLAVOURS
Tangerine, coconut, tropical and stone fruit with hints of cedar
TOTAL OIL COMPOSITION
Alpha w/w – 12.0-16.0%
Beta w/w – 4-7%
Total Oils mls/100gm – 2.5-3.0
Cohumulone – 20-24% of alpha acids
Myrcene (of total oil) – 55-65%
Caryophyllene (of total oil) – 11-13%
Humulene (of total oil) – 8-10%
Farnesene (of total oil) – <1%

recipe.notes: Malt is ordered with standard crush @ The Malt Miller (https://www.themaltmiller.co.uk/).

target.name: Hoppy NEIPA
target.description: Increased chloride with restrained sulfate which helps accentuate flavour over bitterness/dryness. The hop bitterness is smoother, less sharp, less dry than the Hoppy profile. Helps support a silky smooth and rich mouthfeel. For hoppy New England style ales.
